tasks.title: Initialize Project Repository and Screaming Architecture
tasks.description: Create the project repository with a Screaming Architecture folder structure, separating domain logic from infrastructure details.
tasks.details: Use Python 3.11+ for best async support. Structure folders as /domain, /infrastructure, /cli, /tests, /features. Add pyproject.toml for dependency management (prefer Poetry). Include .gitignore and README.md. Follow Screaming Architecture principles: domain objects and logic in /domain, API clients in /infrastructure, CLI entrypoint in /cli.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify folder structure matches Screaming Architecture. Ensure all modules are importable and initial test runner executes.

subtasks.title: Create Project Repository and Initialize Git
subtasks.description: Set up a new project repository and initialize it with Git version control.
subtasks.details: Create a new directory for the project, initialize Git, and set up the initial commit. Add a .gitignore file tailored for Python projects.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that the repository is initialized, .gitignore is present, and Git status shows a clean working tree.

subtasks.title: Establish Screaming Architecture Folder Structure
subtasks.description: Create the required folder structure following Screaming Architecture principles.
subtasks.details: Add /domain, /infrastructure, /cli, /tests, and /features folders. Ensure /domain is for domain logic, /infrastructure for API clients and utilities, /cli for CLI entrypoint, /tests for unit tests, and /features for Behave scenarios.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check that all folders exist and match the prescribed structure. Confirm that each folder is empty or contains a placeholder __init__.py.

subtasks.title: Configure Dependency Management with Poetry
subtasks.description: Set up pyproject.toml using Poetry for dependency management and Python version specification.
subtasks.details: Initialize Poetry in the project root, specify Python 3.11+ in pyproject.toml, and add initial dependencies as needed. Ensure pyproject.toml is present and correctly configured.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'poetry install' to verify dependencies are installed and Python version is enforced.

subtasks.title: Add Project Documentation and Metadata Files
subtasks.description: Create README.md and ensure project metadata files are present.
subtasks.details: Write a README.md describing the project, architecture, and setup instructions. Ensure .gitignore and pyproject.toml are included in the repository.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify README.md is informative and all metadata files are present in the repository root.

subtasks.title: Validate Initial Importability and Test Runner Setup
subtasks.description: Ensure all modules are importable and set up an initial test runner.
subtasks.details: Add __init__.py files as needed. Set up a basic test runner (e.g., pytest) in /tests. Confirm that all modules in /domain, /infrastructure, and /cli can be imported without errors.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run the test runner to confirm it executes and imports all modules successfully.

tasks.title: Implement CLI Entry Point with Click
tasks.description: Develop the CLI interface using Click, supporting the 'process' verb and all required options.
tasks.details: Use Click v8.1+ for robust CLI parsing. Implement 'process' command with options: --project, --out, --pat, --log-level, --skip-metrics, --version, --help. Ensure auto-generated help text matches PRD. Place CLI code in /cli/cli.py.
tasks.testStrategy: Write Behave scenarios for CLI invocation. Unit test CLI parsing and option handling.

subtasks.title: Set Up CLI Project Structure
subtasks.description: Create the /cli/cli.py file and initialize the CLI entry point using Click v8.1+.
subtasks.details: Ensure the CLI code is placed in /cli/cli.py and the project is ready for further CLI command implementation.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that the CLI entry point runs without errors and displays a basic help message.

subtasks.title: Implement 'process' Command with Required Options
subtasks.description: Develop the 'process' command in Click, supporting options: --project, --out, --pat, --log-level, --skip-metrics.
subtasks.details: Define the 'process' command and all required options, ensuring correct parsing and validation.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit test option parsing and validation for all supported flags.

subtasks.title: Add Global Options and Version/Help Support
subtasks.description: Integrate --version and --help options, ensuring auto-generated help text matches PRD requirements.
subtasks.details: Configure Click to provide global options and ensure help/version output is accurate and user-friendly.
subtasks.testStrategy: Compare CLI help and version output against PRD; write Behave scenarios for help/version invocation.

subtasks.title: Validate Option Handling and Error Messaging
subtasks.description: Implement robust error handling for missing or invalid options, providing clear user feedback.
subtasks.details: Ensure CLI responds with appropriate error messages for invalid input and missing required options.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit test error cases and verify error messages match PRD expectations.

subtasks.title: Integrate CLI with Behave and Unit Tests
subtasks.description: Write Behave scenarios and unit tests to validate CLI invocation, option handling, and output structure.
subtasks.details: Ensure comprehensive test coverage for CLI behaviors, including all supported options and error cases.
subtasks.testStrategy: Implement Behave scenarios for CLI usage; write unit tests for option parsing and output.

tasks.title: Implement Authentication Logic
tasks.description: Support DefaultAzureCredential chain and PAT override for Azure DevOps and OData APIs.
tasks.details: Use azure-identity==1.14.0 for DefaultAzureCredential. Accept --pat and use for BasicAuth. Implement credential precedence logic. Ensure compatibility with both REST and OData endpoints. Place authentication logic in /infrastructure/auth.py.
tasks.testStrategy: Behave scenarios for both Azure environment and PAT fallback. Mock credential failures and verify error messaging.

tasks.title: Implement Structured JSON Logging
tasks.description: Add structured logging per Better Stack guidance, supporting info/debug/trace levels and JSON output.
tasks.details: Use structlog==23.2.0 for JSON logging. No root logger; configure per module. Support --log-level option. Include timestamps, levels, and trace context. Output logs to stdout and optionally to file. Place logging config in /infrastructure/logging.py.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit test log output format. Behave scenarios for log-level switching. Validate logs are JSON and contain required fields.

tasks.title: Implement Resilient Async HTTP Client
tasks.description: Develop an async HTTP client with exponential backoff for 429/503, supporting up to 10 concurrent requests.
tasks.details: Use httpx==0.27.0 with asyncio for concurrency. Integrate tenacity==8.2.2 for exponential backoff. Limit concurrency with asyncio.Semaphore(10). Centralize error handling for 429/503. Place client in /infrastructure/http_client.py.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit test retry logic and concurrency limits. Behave scenarios for simulated transient failures.

subtasks.title: Design Async HTTP Client Interface
subtasks.description: Define the interface and structure for the async HTTP client, specifying methods for GET, POST, and error handling.
subtasks.details: Create a class in /infrastructure/http_client.py with async methods for HTTP operations. Ensure extensibility for future features.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit test method signatures and basic instantiation.

subtasks.title: Integrate httpx with Asyncio Concurrency Control
subtasks.description: Implement async HTTP requests using httpx==0.27.0, managing concurrency with asyncio.Semaphore(10).
subtasks.details: Use asyncio.Semaphore to restrict concurrent requests to 10. Ensure all requests are performed asynchronously.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit test concurrency limits by simulating multiple simultaneous requests.

subtasks.title: Implement Exponential Backoff for 429/503 Responses
subtasks.description: Integrate tenacity==8.2.2 to apply exponential backoff retries for HTTP 429 and 503 errors.
subtasks.details: Configure tenacity retry logic to trigger on 429/503 responses, with customizable backoff parameters.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit test retry behavior using mocked 429/503 responses.

subtasks.title: Centralize Error Handling for Transient Failures
subtasks.description: Develop centralized error handling logic for 429/503 responses and other transient errors within the client.
subtasks.details: Create a unified error handling mechanism to log, retry, and escalate errors as needed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit test error handling paths and ensure correct logging and retry escalation.

subtasks.title: Finalize Client Implementation and Documentation
subtasks.description: Refactor, document, and ensure the client is production-ready in /infrastructure/http_client.py.
subtasks.details: Add docstrings, usage examples, and finalize code structure. Ensure compliance with project standards.
subtasks.testStrategy: Code review, documentation validation, and integration tests with simulated failures.

tasks.title: Fetch Project Metadata from Azure DevOps REST APIs
tasks.description: Implement logic to fetch work-item types, fields, behaviors, teams, backlogs, and team settings for a given project.
tasks.details: Use azure-devops==7.1.0 or direct REST calls via httpx. Endpoints: /wit/workitemtypes, /wit/fields, /processes/{id}/behaviors, /core/teams, /work/backlogs, /work/teamsettings. Serialize results into domain objects. Place logic in /domain/metadata.py.
tasks.testStrategy: Behave scenarios for each endpoint. Unit test response parsing and error handling.

tasks.title: Fetch Activity Metrics via OData Analytics v4
tasks.description: Query OData Analytics endpoints for monthly aggregates of work items, PRs, and pipeline runs.
tasks.details: Use httpx async client for OData queries. Endpoints: WorkItemsSnapshot, WorkItemRevisions, PullRequestEvents, /pipelines/{id}/runs. Aggregate by month using pandas==2.2.2 for in-memory grouping. Place logic in /domain/metrics.py.
tasks.testStrategy: Behave scenarios for metrics collection. Unit test aggregation logic and error handling.

tasks.title: Enrich Users via Microsoft Graph API
tasks.description: Lookup Azure DevOps identities in Microsoft Graph to fetch job title and mail, and annotate usage patterns.
tasks.details: Use msgraph-core==1.0.0 and httpx for Graph API calls. For each unique user ID, fetch /users/{id}. Annotate users with PR-heavy or work-item-heavy based on metrics. Place enrichment logic in /domain/user_enrichment.py.
tasks.testStrategy: Behave scenarios for user enrichment. Unit test Graph API integration and annotation logic.

tasks.title: Serialize Domain Objects to JSON with orjson
tasks.description: Serialize all collected domain objects into a single portable JSON file using orjson.
tasks.details: Use orjson==3.9.10 for fast serialization. Ensure output matches published schema and is â‰¤50 MB for typical projects. Place serialization logic in /infrastructure/serialization.py.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit test serialization for schema compliance and file size. Behave scenario for end-to-end export.

tasks.title: Implement Error Handling and Exit Codes
tasks.description: Handle errors per PRD: fatal exit for Analytics root unreachable, warnings for partial fetch failures, credential errors.
tasks.details: Centralize error handling in /cli/cli.py. Map scenarios to exit codes: 0 (success), 1 (partial), 2 (fatal Analytics error). Emit warnings array in JSON output. Log errors with context.
tasks.testStrategy: Behave scenarios for each error case. Unit test exit code logic and warning emission.

tasks.title: Implement --skip-metrics Option
tasks.description: Support CLI option to export configuration only, skipping all Analytics queries.
tasks.details: Add --skip-metrics flag to CLI. Bypass metrics collection logic if set. Ensure output JSON omits metrics section when skipped.
tasks.testStrategy: Behave scenario for --skip-metrics. Unit test output structure.

tasks.title: Publish and Version JSON Schema
tasks.description: Publish the JSON schema for the export artefact and version it for downstream consumers.
tasks.details: Define schema in /infrastructure/schema.json. Use jsonschema==4.22.0 for validation. Publish schema to repository and document versioning strategy.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit test schema validation. Behave scenario for schema compliance.

tasks.title: Acceptance Test Suite with Behave
tasks.description: Develop BDD acceptance tests mapping each requirement to Gherkin scenarios, executed against ephemeral Azure DevOps org.
tasks.details: Use behave==1.2.6 for BDD. Place features in /features. Automate ephemeral org setup in CI using azdo-demo-org. Map each PRD requirement to a scenario.
tasks.testStrategy: Run Behave suite in CI. Ensure all scenarios pass and failures are logged with rich context.

subtasks.title: Extract PRD Requirements for Test Mapping
subtasks.description: Review the Product Requirements Document (PRD) and extract all requirements that need to be mapped to acceptance tests.
subtasks.details: Gather and document each PRD requirement to ensure comprehensive coverage in the test suite.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify all PRD requirements are listed and none are omitted.

subtasks.title: Author Gherkin Scenarios for Each Requirement
subtasks.description: Write Gherkin scenarios in .feature files for each PRD requirement, ensuring clarity and traceability.
subtasks.details: Place all .feature files in the /features directory, with each scenario clearly mapped to its corresponding requirement.
subtasks.testStrategy: Review scenarios for completeness and direct mapping to requirements; peer review for Gherkin syntax.

subtasks.title: Implement Behave Step Definitions
subtasks.description: Develop Python step definitions for all Gherkin scenarios using behave==1.2.6.
subtasks.details: Ensure step definitions are modular, reusable, and placed in the appropriate /features/steps directory.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit test step definitions for correctness; ensure all steps are covered and executable.

subtasks.title: Automate Ephemeral Azure DevOps Org Setup in CI
subtasks.description: Integrate azdo-demo-org into CI to provision and tear down ephemeral Azure DevOps organizations for test execution.
subtasks.details: Configure CI pipeline to automatically create and destroy orgs for each test run, ensuring isolation and repeatability.
subtasks.testStrategy: Validate org setup and teardown in CI logs; ensure no residual resources remain post-test.

subtasks.title: Execute and Validate Behave Suite in CI
subtasks.description: Run the Behave acceptance test suite in CI against the ephemeral Azure DevOps org, capturing and reporting results.
subtasks.details: Ensure all scenarios are executed, failures are logged with rich context, and results are published as CI artefacts.
subtasks.testStrategy: Confirm all scenarios pass; verify failure logs contain detailed context; ensure artefacts are accessible.

tasks.title: Continuous Integration Setup
tasks.description: Configure CI pipeline to run tests, Behave acceptance suite, and measure runtime and file size metrics.
tasks.details: Use GitHub Actions or Azure Pipelines. Steps: lint (ruff), unit tests (pytest), Behave acceptance, runtime/file size checks. Publish logs and artefacts. Place CI config in /.github/workflows/ci.yml.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify CI runs on PR and main. Ensure artefacts and logs are published. Behave failures block merge.

tasks.title: Documentation and CLI Help Verification
tasks.description: Document usage, options, error codes, and ensure CLI help matches PRD requirements.
tasks.details: Update README.md with usage, options, error handling, and schema info. Verify Click auto-generated help matches PRD. Document authentication precedence and troubleshooting.
tasks.testStrategy: Manual review of documentation. Behave scenario for --help output. Validate README completeness.
